name: Original Art Warm and Wonderful Teak Wood by Tracy Melton
description:
" Full Circle" A original painting on Teak wood by Tracy Melton

This wonderful painting is done on a Teak wood crate I bought from a flower farm in Michigan. The wood has lots of worn character. It is painted with acrylic, and sealed with a clear gloss varnish.

- Each Painting measures approximately: 2 ft x 3 ft and 4" in deep

- Each painting has been clear-coated with polycrylic 3 times

name: Shipwreck A Original Sculpture by Tracy Melton
description:
" Shipwreck " A Sculpture by Tracy Melton


Ahoy! This piece was assembled with old reclaimed wood I found on the beach north of Santa Cruz, Ca. It has been planed, sands, painted, and clear coated. 

3 ft x 4 ft.

name: Art Modern Unique And Sleek Original Paintings By Tracy Melton
description:
Original paintings on Red Elm trees by artist Tracy Melton.

• This sale is for the 12 paintings shown above.

•Three original paintings. Each Painting measures approximately: 5.0" -5.5" inches in diameter.

2.5" inches deep each.

name: Modern Art on Wood Paintings by Tracy Melton Give The Gift of Art
description:
"Tree Ring Series" by Tracy Melton

Original paintings on Red Elm Trees by Tracy Melton

• This sale is for the three paintings shown above. 

•Three original paintings. Each Painting measures approximately: 5.5" -6.5" inches in diameter.

2.5" inches deep each.


 After two months of cutting, sanding, fighting off ticks and mosquitoes, being covered in sweat and sawdust, meticulously concentrating on color placement and collaboration, I am VERY PROUD to finally announce brand new sets of the "Tree Ring Paintings" !

The Process:

I am very particular about which Red Elm trees I select from the woods. I look for the most interesting trees. Making sure they have no cracks in them. The bark has long fallen from the tree, exposing wonderful pattens from bugs, beautiful lichens, burled knots, and the occasional raccoon claw mark. The inside of the tree dark red in color, and is full of tree rings that a very close together. This closeness creates a heavy, dense piece of wood that I have sanded smooth so that the painting feels good in your hand. I use liquitex acrylic paint on my art so that the colors are bright, rich, and bold. I apply three coats of polycrylic to give the paintings a high gloss finish.

The juxtaposition of the organic wooden shapes, and the perfect circles create a work of art that is visually pleasing to the eye, and works well in any interior. 


What inspires me:

I am inspired by unique objects that I see in nature: hollowed out trees, wildflowers, salamander spots, clear, cold mountain streams, fungi, rattlesnake skin, moss, lichen on rocks, mountain rain pouring straight down, the Great Smoky Mountains, creek bottoms, Tennessee in the cool and green spring, the Grand Canyon in winter, and wide open spaces.

Some recent clients include:

- CBS's " Two Broke Girls" Season 3

- NBC's "Parenthood" Seasons 3 and 4

- Mcgraw- Hill Publishing (The Aims of Argument, College Text, Front Cover)

- Memphis Children's Hospital 

- Martha Stewart (2012 and 2008) seasons : 
http://www.marthastewart.com/902181/tree-ring-paintings
- University of Southern California Student Health Center

-Lendrum Fine Art Los Angeles, CA

- Nationwide Insurance Collaborative Space, Columbus, Ohio

 My work has been featured on Apartmenttherapy.com,Dwell.com, Huffingtonpost.com, style carrot.com, moderninkmag.com, urbanoutfitters.com,makezine.com.

Please watch my new video of me creating some Tree Ring Paintings. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XAidQt1bO3g
